title: Philosophical Writing Workshop for Mathematical Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational numerical logic comprehension and introductory college-level mathematics knowledge
context.additional_context: Emphasis on digital device utilization and philosophical interpretation of mathematical concepts

learning_goals: Learners will be able to write a philosophical reflection (500+ characters) on mathematical concepts (e.g., infinity, proof, axioms).
Learners will be able to revise and improve writing drafts at least twice based on peer feedback.
Learners will be able to apply strategies for structuring mathematical arguments (e.g., syllogism, hypothesis-verification model) in actual writing.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
